answers.answer: Hi. Anxiety can cause itching.  Have you changed soaps, laundry detergent, lotions, cologne....anything lately?  That is normally the cause of itching.  Think back to anything new you switched to, but I really feel you need to see a Dermatologist.Similasan is for pink eye, I don't see how this would benefit you.  I don't know where you live but check to see if there are any clinics in your area that can help you at little to no cost. For now try some Cortizone 10 cream to help with the itching.  If it is anxiety you need to see someone to help with that.  I wish I could be of more help.  Best wishes.

Thank you for the response..... i am slowly getting  there... i am trying to eliminate different things.. such as stds which i can erase... now trying B-12 deficiency... i started with new detergent and new boxers... if all this neg... next step for me diabetes then dermatologist... sorry i know it is a pain. I just don't have insurance... just graduated and will start working at job august offer general insurance... maybe there i will be able to talk to a doctor...thanks for your answer!

Sorry i forget to say the reason i am looking anxiety is because i was recommende by urologist look at that as cause too... i could be self creating believe that i have something wrong. Thanks for the help.

question: Hello,I have posted on urology forum because i had everyday tingling down there, i have  also experience itchiness everywhere, I i have also had description tingling on the hands and feet, I have rule out virus such as hsv because of two blood exams. The urology doctor of the forum suggested some possible causes which one  was anxiety. I believe i had some level on anxiety. Unfortunetly on my case i don't have the insurance because i just graduate from college and I have to done the test the hard way out my own pocket and couldn't get appt with urologist or dermatologist. This started more then three months ago and it has gone everyday... i am trying to eliminate possible causes such as anxiety. I want to get Similasan, would you recommend it? I am sorry i am little vague but if have questions please asked.Thank You Doctor
title: Anxiety... Help
